headline: 3 Reasons KMB is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Over the past six months, Kimberly-Clark’s stock price fell to $120.77. Shareholders have lost 10.2% of their capital, which is disappointing considering the S&P 500 has climbed by 33.2%. This might have investors contemplating their next move.
